instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3437-B ssd not detecting
threads.message:
hi, i have 820-3437b for repairs, the customer said its not detectin ssd, he has tried same ssd in different macbook and it works.
the board doesn't have any signs of liquid damage
i am fairly new with macbook repairs, so i don't know where to start with this type of problem
is there anyone who has dealt with this type of problem before?

threads.title: 820-3437-B ssd not detecting
threads.message:
Does SSD have High Sierra installed? If yes, probably APFS issue. Boot to USB or internet restore and see if SSD is showing in disk utility. If it does, then either wipe SSD and install OSX fresh and update to High Sierra, or install 2nd SSD, update to High Sierra so board's firmware is updated with APFS support, then replace original SSD.

If SSD does not have HS installed, and issue is not APFS-related, then post back.

threads.title: 820-3437-B ssd not detecting

If SSD does not have HS installed, and issue is not APFS-related, then post back.[/QUOTE]

Doesn't show any disk in disk utility. it think its something with logicboard

threads.title: 820-3437-B ssd not detecting
threads.message: okay, so i checked with my ssd that have windows on it and when i press option during startup, it only shows windows partition, and mac partiton is not showing up

threads.title: 820-3437-B ssd not detecting
threads.message: This is probably the APFS problem. Just do a clean install on a known good SSD and it will update the board to support APFS.
